RNAlysis quick-start video guideÔÉÅ

Launching RNAlysisÔÉÅ

Open the graphical user interface by running rnalysis-gui in your terminal or executing gui.run_gui() in a Python console.

Importing DataÔÉÅ

Select a file from your computer and click ‚ÄòStart‚Äô to import it into RNAlysis.

Exploring Your DatasetÔÉÅ

View an overview of your data, including table name, type, and dimensions. Use the ‚ÄòView full table‚Äô button for a comprehensive look.

Applying FiltersÔÉÅ

Select a filtering function, adjust parameters, and click ‚ÄòApply‚Äô to modify your table. Changes won‚Äôt affect the original file until saved.

Undo the operations you applied to your dataÔÉÅ

Use the ‚ÄòCommand history‚Äô window to undo or redo operations applied to your table at any time.

Apply your operations ‚Äòin-place‚Äô or make a copyÔÉÅ

Apply operations ‚Äòin-place‚Äô or to a copy of your table in a new tab, leaving the original unmodified.

Generating and Saving VisualizationsÔÉÅ

Create graphs of your data, resize them, and save in various file formats for further use or presentation.

Analyze Multiple Tables at the Same TimeÔÉÅ

Open new tabs to work on multiple tables simultaneously, enhancing your analytical capabilities.

Organizing Your WorkspaceÔÉÅ

Sort tabs and customize their colors to efficiently manage your analytical workspace.

Saving Modified TablesÔÉÅ

Click ‚ÄòSave table‚Äô to store the results of your filtering operations in a location of your choice.

Creating Gene SetsÔÉÅ

Import lists of genes as Gene Sets for specialized analysis within RNAlysis.

Visualizing Gene Set IntersectionsÔÉÅ

Use the ‚ÄòVisualize Gene Sets‚Äô window to create Venn diagrams and UpSet plots, illustrating intersections between tables and gene sets.

Performing Set OperationsÔÉÅ

Extract specific subsets from your data using predefined set operations or by selecting subsets in the preview pane.

Conducting Enrichment AnalysisÔÉÅ

Perform various types of enrichment analysis on your filtered tables and gene sets to gain biological insights.

Rapid Gene Information LookupÔÉÅ

Right-click to quickly access gene information from various biological databases, customizable in the settings menu.

Building Analysis PipelinesÔÉÅ

Group multiple operations with specific parameters into a Pipeline to streamline your data analysis workflow.

Executing PipelinesÔÉÅ

Apply Pipelines to multiple tables simultaneously, enhancing efficiency and reducing errors in your analysis.

Sharing and Reproducing AnalysesÔÉÅ

Export and share Pipelines to facilitate reproducibility and collaborative analysis across different computers.

Integrating External Bioinformatic ToolsÔÉÅ

Access a graphical interface for various bioinformatic tools, covering stages from adapter trimming to differential expression analysis.

Leveraging Table-Specific FunctionsÔÉÅ

Specify table types when loading to access specialized functions, such as clustering analysis for count matrices.

Recovering Closed TabsÔÉÅ

Restore accidentally closed tabs through the ‚ÄòEdit‚Äô menu to recover your work.

Generating Interactive Analysis ReportsÔÉÅ

Create comprehensive, interactive analysis reports with a single click, automatically including all generated tables, gene sets, and graphs.
